text: Hello everyone, in this video I will show you how to run HTML files using Visual Studio Code.
So we need to install a new extension called OpenEnd Browser.
So let's click on this extensions button and here let's type OpenEnd Browser.
Then let's click on this first extension.
So this is the name of the developer and this is the number of times it has been installed.
To install this extension we need just to click on this install button.
Now the extension is installed correctly so we can close this page and also we can hide the extensions.
Now let's create a new HTML file. So let's click on file, then open folder.
Then I will create a new folder on the desktop.
I will call it Website.
Let's select this folder.
Then let's create a new HTML file.
I will call it home.html.
Now let's write some HTML code so we can type exclamation mark.
Then let's hit enter and we obtain this template. We can change the title.
And also we can write some text in the body.
Now let's save this file and to open it in the browser we can either make a right click here and then open in default browser
or also we can make a right click on the file in the explorer.
Then open in default browser.
And we obtain this page in the browser.
In the next video I will show you how to set up Visual Studio Code for web development using an extension called LiveServer.
